text:
A Fog of Solitude

Raskolnikov sits alone in a dimly lit room.  
His thoughts swirl like a fog.  
Raskolnikov: “What is real anymore?”  
Raskolnikov: “Everything feels distorted.”  

---

Raskolnikov wanders through a dreary street.  
He feels panic rising within him.  
Raskolnikov: “I can’t escape this dread.”  
Raskolnikov: “Am I losing my mind?”  

---

Raskolnikov stares blankly at the ground.  
Moments of apathy wash over him.  
Raskolnikov: “I just want peace.”  
Raskolnikov: “Why can’t I feel anything?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences a disorienting period of solitude and mental turmoil, struggling to reconcile his thoughts and fears amidst impending catastrophe.
